He reeks of alcohol.}} ==Useful Info== '''Wiglaf the dwarf''' is a [[unique]] [[mountain dwarf]] fighter who worships [[Okawaru]], and will attempt to invoke [[Haste]] and [[Might]] before engaging you in melee. He comes with decent equipment, and once buffed, can deal gruesome damage in melee. ==Location== *[[The Depths]]:1-3 *The [[Elven Halls]]:2-3 *The [[Snake Pit]]:2-4 *The [[Spider's Nest]]:2-4 *[[The Vaults]] *[[The Crypt]] ==Spells== {{Spellcaster2 |number= |slot1=[[Might]] |flags1={{Priest slot flag}} |slot2=[[Haste]] |flags2={{Priest slot flag}} }} {{clear}} ==Tips & Tricks== Wiglaf may be strong, but he has numerous vulnerabilities. Firstly, one can soften him up from a distance. He has no ranged abilities unless he happens to find a weapon and ammunition lying around, but his ability to haste himself means he may be able to get close to you before you can take him out. Haste yourself to maintain the gap, and hit him with your most powerful conjurations. If you're a melee fighter, you might simply try hasting yourself and drinking a [[potion of might]] before engaging him in melee; generally, you will have superior damage output. If you yourself worship Okawaru, you can use his Finesse ability, which is superior to Wiglaf's Haste. Lastly, one can attempt to close to melee range before he can cast Haste or Might - once in melee, he'll rarely cast them. ==Trivia== [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wiglaf Wiglaf] is a character in the Anglo-Saxon epic poem ''Beowulf''. ==History== {{CBA|0.32|Wiglaf will return with an artefact [[hat]] and [[Hellfire Mortar]]. He'll alternate with [[Joseph]], so only one of them will spawn in any given game.}} *In [[0.19]], Wiglaf was no more; he bit the dust with the rest of the mountain dwarves. *In [[0.15]] his glyph was changed from 'q' to 'g'. *Prior to [[0.8]], he was known as Wayne. *Prior to [[0.7]], he was not an Okawaru worshiper and lacked his special abilities.
